q: 7, 2011 Donald Rumsfeld unapologetic about Iraq President Bush Defense Donald Rumsfeld is conceding "it's possible" that the biggest mistake of the Iraq war came in drawing down troops too quickly. In a war, many things cost lives, Donald Rumsfeld said in an interview with ABC News airing Monday in advance of the release of his memoir on his long career in public service. It's not as meaningful to get a compliment from someone who's always nice. In past seasons, you'd see people running out of the[ judging] room saying,` Simon Cowell loved me!' Simon Cowell was always the one people cared about, because he was the hardest one to get. Thompson points out that, as a British unknown looking for American fame, Simon Cowell used meanness as a savvy PR move- one that wouldn"t work for Jennifer Lopez or Steven Tyler . Barack Obama has pledged to freeze non-defense discretionary spending, and Republicans have said they want to roll back this spending to 2008 levels, but Colin Powell said neither idea constitutes a plan to substantially cut the deficit. I am put off when people say you are going to freeze spending or roll it back to 2008 levels, Colin Powell said. Instead, politicians should spell out what they would cut, he said. "He's my first Division I recruit," the Albert said of Jarrell McKinney . He has tremendous speed. He runs the 40 in 4.5. He's 6-5, 210, and when he goes to college they're going to put another 20-30 pounds on him. Playing defensive end, he's going to be outstanding. He's the role model for our other kids.... He's that bar that we have to set for ourselves. Cody has an experienced offensive line and receivers coming back, and the Albert said junior-to-be quarterback Mario Gulley "has Michael Vick capabilities."
